definition: to make a firm resolution
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny is determined to hold on to his Arsenal place next season.
sentences.chinese: 什琴斯尼下定決心要在下賽季保住他的首發地位。

sentences.english: The person that ends up a winner,is the one who resolves to win.
sentences.chinese: 最終的贏家就是下定決心要贏的那個人。

sentences.english: Make up your mind, you’ll never use crutches or a stick, then have a go at everything.
sentences.chinese: 下定決心之後，你就永遠不會需要拐杖或者棍子。

sentences.english: Ayden: Well, yesterday, I decided to face my fear of heights.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，昨天我下定決心正視自己的恐高問題。

sentences.english: Let us be determined not to collect grievances today.
sentences.chinese: 今天讓我們下定決心，不再去累積任何怨尤。

sentences.english: Once he had made up his mind, he went the whole hog.
sentences.chinese: 她一旦下定決心，就會幹到底。

sentences.english: He decided, once and for all, not to be forgetful in the future.
sentences.chinese: 他下定決心，從此絕不再丟三落四了。

sentences.english: Thinking over for a long time, finally I made up my mind to write the letter.
sentences.chinese: 想了好久，終於還是下定決心提筆寫了這封信。

sentences.english: You are capable of doing anything you set your mind to.
sentences.chinese: 你可以成功的做好任何你下定決心要去做的事。

sentences.english: She dreaded seeing Wickham again, and was resolved to avoid it as long as possible.
sentences.chinese: 她已經下定決心，能夠和他避而不見就儘量避而不見。

sentences.english: so I decided to come back.
sentences.chinese: 所以我下定決心重拾學業。

sentences.english: In Apia, though, opponents are determined to fight the change.
sentences.chinese: 然而在阿皮亞，反對者已經下定決心要抗爭下去。

sentences.english: Do not , for repulse, give up the purpose that you resolved to effect.
sentences.chinese: 不要因爲挫敗就放棄你下定決心實現的目標。

sentences.english: Thus, early on, he determined to study God's law.
sentences.chinese: 一開始，他就下定決心學習神的律法。

sentences.english: If he's set his mind on doing it, nothing will stop him.
sentences.chinese: 他一旦下定決心去做，任何事情也擋不住他。

sentences.english: She was determined that she would become a liberated businesswoman.
sentences.chinese: 她下定決心做一個思想解放的女實業家。

definition: to decide (to do something)/to resolve/decision/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]/certainly
to renounce/to abandon/to give up
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
to resume/to restart/to start afresh
to summon one's courage
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to bear fruit/CL:個|个[ge4]
thorough/thoroughly/complete
thought/idea/intention
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
at once/immediately
afterwards/later
to depart/to leave
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
